[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: estimate_gas_price()] [Gas Estimation Race] Is there a TOCTOU vulnerability where gas estimation returns a price that becomes stale before transaction submission, causing transaction rejections? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: log_gas_estimation()] [Gas Metrics Manipulation] Can an attacker flood the API with gas estimation requests to manipulate the GAS_ESTIMATE metrics, affecting prioritized/deprioritized gas calculations for other users? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create_internal()] [Mempool Status Code Mapping] Can an attacker exploit gaps in MempoolStatusCode mapping to cause transactions with specific mempool errors to be treated as successful submissions? (High)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create_internal()] [VM Status Extraction] When MempoolStatusCode::VmError occurs but vm_status_opt is None, does returning StatusCode::UNKNOWN_STATUS leak information about internal VM state? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create_internal()] [Invalid Sequence Number Handling] Can an attacker exploit the InvalidSeqNumber error mapping to determine exact sequence numbers of accounts by submitting probe transactions? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create_internal()] [Transaction Filter Rejection] Can RejectedByFilter errors leak information about internal transaction filtering rules that could be exploited to bypass filters? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create()] [Pending Transaction Leak] When returning PendingTransaction in JSON format, does the conversion expose internal mempool state that could be exploited for timing attacks? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create_batch()] [Batch Partial Success] In batch submission, can an attacker exploit the partial success scenario (AcceptedPartial) to cause inconsistent mempool state where some transactions succeed but related transactions fail? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: create_batch()] [Batch Atomicity] Does the batch submission lack atomicity guarantees, allowing attackers to submit transaction chains where early transactions succeed but later ones fail, leaving accounts in inconsistent states? (High)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: submit_transactions_batch()] [Batch Size Check] Can an attacker submit a batch that passes max_submit_transaction_batch_size() check but contains transactions that individually exceed size limits? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Encrypted Transaction Check] Can the is_encrypted_variant() check be bypassed by wrapping encrypted payloads in other payload types that aren't checked? (Critical)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Simulation VM Divergence] Can AptosSimulationVM produce different results than AptosVM for the same transaction, causing users to submit transactions that fail in actual execution? (High)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Zero Hash State] Does using zero_hash for state_hash, accumulator_root_hash in simulated transactions cause issues if code relies on hash uniqueness for deduplication? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Execution Status Combination] Can the ExecutionStatus::conmbine_vm_status_for_simulation() function (note: typo in name) produce inconsistent execution statuses that mislead users? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Event Translation] Does translate_v2_to_v1_events_for_simulation() properly handle all event types, or can malicious contracts emit events that crash the translation? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Gas Used Reporting] Can the gas_used value from simulation differ significantly from actual execution gas due to state differences, causing users to set insufficient gas limits? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate()] [Function Stats Key Generation] Can the stats_key generation for different transaction types be exploited to poison simulation statistics by submitting many simulation requests with specific payload patterns? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: simulate_transaction()] [API Filter Check] Can an attacker probe the api_filter.transaction_filter() rules by submitting many simulation requests to map out which transactions are allowed/forbidden? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: get_by_hash()] [Hash Collision] If two transactions have the same hash due to a cryptographic collision, which transaction is returned, and can this be exploited for transaction confusion attacks? (Critical)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: get_by_hash()] [Mempool vs Storage Race] Can race conditions between mempool and storage lookups cause the same transaction to be returned as both pending and committed in different API calls? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: get_by_hash()] [Version Inconsistency] Can the internal_ledger_version and storage_ledger_version mismatch cause transactions to be reported at incorrect versions? (High)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: get_transaction_by_hash_inner()] [Ledger Info Race] Can the race between get_latest_internal_and_storage_ledger_info() calls and actual transaction lookup cause version inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: wait_transaction_by_hash_inner()] [Wait Timeout] Can an attacker submit many wait_by_hash requests to exhaust the wait_by_hash_max_active_connections limit, denying service to legitimate users? (Medium)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: wait_transaction_by_hash_inner()] [Polling Loop] Can the polling loop continue indefinitely if a transaction remains pending beyond timeout but the timeout check fails due to time manipulation? (Low)

[File: api/src/transactions.rs] [Function: wait_transaction_by_hash_inner()] [Connection Counting Race] Is there a race condition in the atomic fetch_add/fetch_sub operations on wait_for_hash_active_connections that could cause incorrect connection counting? (Medium)
